text:
Aoi
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND WELFARE
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
NATIONAL INSTITUTES OF HEALTH

 

 

October 24, 1978 NATIONAL CANCER INSTITUTE

Dr. William U. Gardner

‘The Council for Tobacco Research-U.S.A., Inc.
110 East 59th Street

New York, New York 10022

Re

 

: Proposed site visitors to U. South Florida (Dr. J. W. Frankel)
Dear Bill:

I think the following would be very appropriate visitors to Dr. Frankel's
facilities:

Dr. Henry Lynch

Dr, Raymond Seltser, Professor of Epidemiology
Deputy Director of the Johns Hopkins Oncology Center
Johns Hopkins University School of Public Health
G15 N. Wolfe Street

Baltimore, Maryland 21205 (301) 955-3347

Dr. Rulon Rawson, Director
Bonneville Center for Research on Cancer
Cause and Prevention
University of Utah Research Institute
520 Wakara Way
Salt Lake City, Utah 84108 (801) 581-8267

With best wishes,

Sincerely,

Be

Robert J, Huebner, M.D.

 

prin unone, ete eis Ua Sale Laboratory of Cellular and
ee eae tae Kage eget kay Molecular Biology

 

 

     
   

Grigg Ce ME

 

   

edicanoet gee

   
 
  
 
  

      
 

 

  
   

50135575

summary: In 1978, Dr. J. W. Frankel sent a letter to the director of the National Cancer Institute in New York. The letter was in response to a request for visitors for a cancer research facility in South Florida. In the letter, the author suggested that the following people should visit the facility: Dr William U. Gardner and Dr Henry Lynch.
